subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=c|rs=金10|kyu=鎻}}

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くさり}}
Noun derived from the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|鏈る|tr=kusaru||to be linked together, to link together}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|くさり|y=k|acc=0|dev=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|鎖鎌|くさりがま}}: a [[chain]] [[sickle]]
* {{ja-r|鎖分銅|くさり ふんどう}}: a [[weighted]] [[chain]]

subSections.title: Related terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|鏈る|くさる}}: to be linked together, to link together

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|とざし}}
Noun derived from the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|鎖す|tr=tozasu||to shut and lock a door or gate}}.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|とざし|y=k}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|とざし}}

# the [[close|closing]] and [[lock]]ing of a [[door]] or [[gate]]
# a door or gate so closed and locked
# a [[bar]] or other [[device]] used to lock a door or gate

subSections.title: Related terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|鎖す}}, {{ja-l|閉ざす|とざす|tozasu}}: to close and lock a door or gate

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つがり}}
Noun derived from the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|連る|tr=tsugaru||to continue, to lead onto the next, to be connected; to connect or link together}}.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|つがり|y=k}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|鎖り}}, {{ja-l|連}}, {{ja-l|連り}}, {{ja-l|繋り}}, {{ja-l|綴り}}, {{ja-l|縋り}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|つがり}}

# a [[connection]], [[linkage]], or [[continuation]]
# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=つがり}} a [[chain]]
# a [[string]] of items [[tie]]d together
# the part of the [[opening]] of a [[drawstring]] [[bag]] through which the string is passed

subSections.title: Related terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|鎖る}}, {{ja-l|連る}}, {{ja-l|繋る}}, {{ja-l|綴る}}, {{ja-l|縋る}} (''tsugaru''): to continue, to lead onto the next, to be connected; to connect or link together

subSections.title: Etymology 4
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|さ|y=o}}

subSections.title: Affix
Derived terms
Etymology 5
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|じょう|y=ky|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|じょう|hhira=ぢやう}}

# {{qualifier|pitch 0}} a [[metal]] [[bar]] used to [[lock]] [[shut]] a [[gate]], [[door]], [[chest]], or other opening
# {{qualifier|pitch 0}} a [[key]] used to lock or [[unlock]] such an opening
# {{qualifier|pitch 1}} a [[pill]] or [[tablet]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
The senses have different pitch accents. A low starting pitch is used for the {{m|en|lock}} or {{m|en|key}} meanings, while a high starting pitch is used for the {{m|en|pill}} or {{m|en|tablet}} meanings.

The alternate spelling {{ja-l|錠}} was originally an [[ateji]], but in reference to openings, the meaning was limited to {{m|en|key}}, while the {{m|en|lock}} sense was spelled {{lang|ja|鎖}}. In modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, these characters are largely interchangeable for both {{m|en|lock}} and {{m|en|key}} senses. However, the more common term for {{m|en|key}} is {{ja-l|鍵}} (''kagi'').

The {{m|en|pill}} sense is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|錠}}.

subSections.title: Counter
Usage notes
subSections.text: More commonly spelled {{ja-l|錠}}.

subSections.text: <references/>
